pingball.simulation

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • pingball.simulation.GameObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ball, Gadget, Wall

    public abstract class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
    An object that appears on the board. The game objects can be a ball, a bounding wall or a gadget.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameObject()

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameObject

        public GameObject()

    • Method Detail

      • getLocation

        public abstract GridLocation getLocation()
        Returns the grid location of the top left corner of the game object.
        Returns:
        The grid location.

      • gridRepresentation

        public abstract java.util.List<java.lang.String> gridRepresentation()
        Returns a list of strings for the string representation of the game object. Each string in the list represents a row of the bounding square of the object, Number of strings is equal to the height of the bounding square of the object The rows are aligned with respect to the top left of the object.
        Returns:
        The grid representation

      • evolve

        public void evolve(double time)
        Evolve the game object for the specified period of time.
        Parameters:
        time - The time period to evolve the object for.

      • collide

        public void collide(Ball ball,
           Collidable collidable)
        Collide the ball with a particular collidable in the game object. If this game object is a ball, then mutate itself also.
        Parameters:
        ball - The ball that collides.
        collidable - The collidable that the ball collides with.

      • timeUntilCollision

        public Pair<java.lang.Double,Collidable> timeUntilCollision(Ball ball)
        Returns the minimum time after which the ball will collide with some collidable in this game object, and also returns the collidable with which it will collide. Assumes ball moves with constant velocity for the specified time period. So, returned value is accurate only for a time period < Simulation timestep.
        Parameters:
        ball - The ball that will collide
        Returns:
        The pair of the minimum time and the collidable with which the ball will collide after that time.
